Summary: Observed orange glowing sphere wobble above horizon, orange light goes dark, followed by flare type object behind and over head of my location.
divs: sighting detailsthis event occured around mid febuary of 1999, sitting on the back of my truck, in my girlfriends driveway, the sun had just set, we were sitting on the tailgate looking at the neighbors treeline directly across the street, this line of trees from were we sat was roughly 150 yards away, that was our horizon, we witnessed what i would describe as a glowing orange ball wobbling slightly back and forth starting to clear the tree line in front of us and moving up. the ball was from my perspective about the diameter of a dime, if you held a dime out in front of your face next to where you see this in the air it was a bit smaller than a dime, it also seemed to be miles behind the treeline in front of us, but that was all we could see was the neighbors woods in front, i knew that he owned a couple acres behind there this could have been miles behind his property. because it looked small but i could clearly see it was orange and round like a ball. i watched it slowly wobble slightly left to right as it rose into the air. this went on for fifteen minutes as it slowly gained altitude all the while wobbling back and fourth, once it reached what appeared from my view point maybe two thousand feet in the air the orange light simply disappeared as if a lite switch was turned off. then about five to ten minutes later something behind and above us cast light onto the ground, very dim but enough to capture my attention, as i turned to look behind maybe a half mile back and around five hundred feet up, moving from right to left, in one motion, was a flaming ball that looked to me like a large, basketball sized roman candle ball shooting behind where we sat. i would guess its rough speed was around 40 miles per hour. it had a slight trail, and was greenish\blue with some white and orange coloring. it went to the left of our view a couple houses over but then went out of view because the land sloped down. i thought this was strange but didn't feel alarmed or frightened by the event, just curious, i thought perhaps someone shot a roman candle but because of its height, speed, burn time, and lack of sound, plus the neighborhood was quiet, i didn't know what to think it was. a month later at the same location, doing the same thing, sitting on the back of the truck, this time a couple hours after the sun had went down, we saw the same sequence of events, the orange ball across the street, followed by the flare\mini meteor object behind us, the only differance this time was that the flare\mini meteor object seemed a bit lower altitude this time, maybe only three hundred feet up, still moving from right to left, but i heard what i would describe as the sound of rock sizzling as it whizzed past us. this is why i call it a mini meteor. the first time this happened in febuary, then a month later. i was in the army stationed at ft.hood texas at the time. i was off duty and off base when this was witnessed on both occasions, the town of kempner is about twenty miles west of the center of ft.hood. when we saw the orange ball we were looking towards the south, ft.hood was to our left, which would have been east, the flare object came east to west. i did read online after this sighting that in 1947 two soldiers stationed at what was then called, camp hood,(ft.hood) witnessed what they described as flare like objects in the sky. in both events i felt normal, no missing time or any strange marks.
trends: There has been one other sighting in Kempner
